<article id="post-589" class="group post-container entry-content">
	
				
	<header class="entry-header">
		<h1 class="entry-title">Major in Scandinavian</h1>
	</header><!-- .entry-header -->

	<div class="entry-content-wrapper">
		<p>The Department of Scandinavian offers an undergraduate major with concentrations in five areas: Danish, Finnish, Norwegian, Old Norse Studies, and Swedish. Each of these concentrations allows students to explore the major while developing expertise within the language and literature of one of the Nordic languages. While the electives built into each of the five concentrations allow room to explore all phases of Scandinavian literature and cultural history from the medieval to the modern, the core courses for each will emphasize the specific language of choice. Students receive further training in their major language skills by pursuing reading in original Scandinavian languages when coursework allows, and through special add-on major units (Scandinavian 149). These units allow students the opportunity to work closely with a professor in their major language area. The Old Norse Studies concentration also allows students with strong interests in comparative medieval studies to choose elective courses offered in that field in other departments to complete their course list for the Scandinavian major.</p>
<p>A new major structure, effective Fall 2015, includes the choice of one of five concentrations. Each concentration requires two new lower-division gateway courses:</p>
<p><strong>SCANDIN 60</strong>: Heroic Legends of the North (4 units) [Spring only]</p>
<p><strong>SCANDIN 75</strong><strong>:</strong> Literature and Culture of the Nordic World (4 units) [Fall only]</p>
<p>In addition, the following lower-division language and upper-division courses are required for each of the concentrations. The total unit requirement for each concentration is 46 units.</p>
<h2 style="text-align: center;">Danish Concentration</h2>
<p><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Lower-division Requirements:</span><br />
<strong>Danish 1A</strong> and<strong> 1B</strong>:  Beginning Danish, Fall and Spring. <strong>8 units</strong><br />
<strong>Scandinavian 60</strong>: Heroic Legends of the North. <strong>4 units</strong><br />
<strong>Scandinavian 75</strong>: Literature and Culture of the Nordic World. <strong>4 units</strong></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Upper-division Requirements<br />
</span><em>Note: Choose Section 103 for Danish language emphasis for Scandinavian 100A-B.<br />
</em><strong>Scandinavian 100A</strong> and <strong>100B</strong>: Scandinavian Languages and Linguistics, Fall and Spring. <strong>8 units</strong><br />
<em>Choose at least one Danish culture course from the following:<br />
</em><strong>Scandinavian 106</strong>: The Works of Hans Christian Andersen. <strong>4 units</strong><br />
<strong>Scandinavian 115</strong>: Studies in Drama and Film. <em>Choose from Danish directors and the topics of Lars von Trier and Carl Dreyer. </em><strong>4 units</strong><br />
<strong>Four upper-division electives</strong> taken in the Department of Scandinavian. See department course listings for selection. <strong>16 units.</strong><br />
Two <strong>Scandinavian 149</strong> reading courses focused on Danish. Taken in conjunction with an upper-division culture or elective course. <strong>1 unit each<br />
</strong></p>
<h2 style="text-align: center;">Finnish Concentration</h2>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Lower-division Requirements:<br />
</span><strong>Finnish 1A</strong> and<strong> 1B</strong>: Beginning Finnish, Fall and Spring. <strong>8 units<br />
Scandinavian 60</strong>: Heroic Legends of the North. <strong>4 units</strong><br />
<strong>Scandinavian 75:</strong> Literature and Culture of the Nordic World. <strong>4 units</strong></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Upper-division Requirements:<br />
</span><strong>Finnish 102A</strong> an<strong>d 102B</strong>: Intermediate Finnish, Fall and Spring. <strong>8 units</strong><br />
<strong>Scandinavian 132</strong>: Introduction to Finnish Culture and History. <strong>4 units<br />
Four upper-division electives</strong> taken in the Department of Scandinavian. See department course listings for selection. <strong>16 units.<br />
</strong>Two <strong>Scandinavian 149</strong> reading courses focused on Finnish. Taken in conjunction with an upper-division culture or elective course. <strong>1 unit each<br />
</strong></p>
<h2 style="text-align: center;">Norwegian Concentration</h2>
<p><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Lower-division Requirements:<br />
</span><strong>Norwegian 1A </strong>and <strong>1B</strong>: Beginning Norwegian, Fall and Spring. <strong>8 units<br />
Scandinavian 60:</strong> Heroic Legends of the North. <strong>4 units</strong><br />
<strong>Scandinavian 75:</strong> Literature and Culture of the Nordic World. <strong>4 units</strong></p>
<p><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Upper-division Requirements:<br />
</span><em>Note: Choose Section 102 for Norwegian language emphasis in Scandinavian 100A-B<br />
</em><strong>Scandinavian 100A</strong> and <strong>100B</strong>: Scandinavian Languages and Linguistics, Fall and Spring. <strong>8 units</strong><br />
<em>Choose at least one Norwegian culture course from the following:<br />
</em><strong>Scandinavian C107:</strong> Plays of Ibsen. <strong>4 units</strong><br />
<strong>Scandinavian 120</strong>: The Novel in Scandinavian.<em> N</em><em>ote: Choose Norwegian author Knut Hamsun.</em><strong> 4 units<br />
Four upper-division electives</strong> taken in the Department of Scandinavian. See department course listings for selection. <strong>16 units.<br />
</strong>Two <strong>Scandinavian 149</strong> reading courses focused on Norwegian. Taken in conjunction with an upper-division culture or elective course. <strong>1 unit each</strong></p>
<h2 style="text-align: center;">Old Norse Studies Concentration</h2>
<p><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Lower-division</span> Requirements:<br />
<em>Select one of the following languages: Danish, Icelandic, Finnish, Norwegian, Swedish, or Latin:</em><br />
<strong>Danish 1A </strong>and <strong>1B: </strong>Beginning Danish, Fall and Spring. <strong>8 units<br />
</strong><strong>Icelandic 1A </strong>and<strong> 1B: </strong>Beginning Modern Icelandic, Fall and Spring. <strong>8 units</strong><br />
<strong>Finnish 1A</strong> and<strong> 1B</strong>: Beginning Finnish, Fall and Spring. <strong>8 units</strong><br />
<strong>Norwegian 1A </strong>and <strong>1B</strong>: Beginning Norwegian, Fall and Spring. <strong>8 units</strong><br />
<strong>Swedish 1A</strong> and <strong>1B</strong>: Beginning Swedish, Fall and Spring. <strong>8 units</strong><br />
<strong>Latin 1</strong> and <strong>2</strong>: Elementary Latin, Fall and Spring. <em>Offered by the Department of Classics</em>. <strong>8 units<br />
Scandinavian 60</strong>: Heroic Legends of the North. <strong>4 units</strong><br />
<strong>Scandinavian 75</strong>: Literature and Culture of the Nordic World. <strong>4 units</strong></p>
<p><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Upper-division Requirements:<br />
</span><em>Select either series: Scandinavian 101A-B (Old Norse) or Scandinavian 201A-B (Old Norse Literature):</em><br />
<strong>Scandinavian 101A</strong> and<strong> 101B</strong>: Introduction to Old Norse I and II, Fall and Spring. <strong>8 units<br />
Scandinavian 201A</strong> and<strong> 201B</strong>: Old Norse and Norse Literature. <em>Scandinavian 201A and 201B are graduate-level courses. Majors are expected in enroll in 101A-101B, and with advance approval by the major advisor and instructor, 201A may be substituted for 101A and 201B for 101B.</em><strong> 8 units<br />
</strong><em>Choose at least 2 Medieval culture courses from the following:<br />
</em><strong>Scandinavian 123</strong>: Viking and Medieval Scandinavia. <strong>4 units<br />
Scandinavian 125</strong>: Old Norse Literature. <strong>4 units<br />
Scandinavian C160</strong>: Scandinavian Myth and Religion. <strong>4 units<br />
Three upper-division electives</strong> taken in the Department of Scandinavian or from Medieval Studies (<em>with permission of the Scandinavian major adviser). </em>See department course listings for selection. <strong>12 units<br />
</strong>Two <strong>Scandinavian 149</strong> reading courses focused on the target language. Taken in conjunction with an upper-division culture or elective course. <strong>1 unit each</strong></p>
<h2 style="text-align: center;">Swedish Concentration</h2>
<p><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Lower-division requirements:</span><br />
<strong>Swedish 1A</strong> and <strong>1B</strong>: Beginning Swedish, Fall and Spring. <strong>8 units<br />
</strong><strong>Scandinavian 60</strong>: Heroic Legends of the North. <strong>4 units</strong><br />
<strong>Scandinavian 75</strong>: Literature and Culture of the Nordic World. <strong>4 units</strong></p>
<p><span style="text-decoration: underline;">Upper-division requirements:<br />
</span><em>Note: Choose Section 101 for Swedish language emphasis for Scandinavian 100A-B.<br />
</em><strong>Scandinavian 100A</strong> and <strong>100B</strong>: Scandinavian Languages and Linguistics, Fall and Spring. <strong>8 units</strong><br />
<em>Choose at least one Swedish culture course from the following:<br />
</em><strong>Scandinavian C108</strong>: Strindberg. <strong>4 units</strong><br />
<strong>Scandinavian 115</strong>: Studies in Drama and Film. <em>Choose film topic on Ingmar Bergman</em>. <strong>4 units<br />
Four upper-division electives</strong> taken in the Department of Scandinavian. See department course listings for selection. <strong>16 units</strong><br />
Two <strong>Scandinavian 149</strong> reading courses focused on Swedish. Taken in conjunction with an upper-division culture or elective course. <strong>1 unit each</strong></p>
<p>The department encourages all students interested in the undergraduate major in Scandinavian to declare the major as early as possible in their academic careers (even as early as the freshman and sophomore years) in order to make planning easier. Please contact the current Faculty Undergraduate Adviser, who can provide general information, a program brochure and scheduling worksheet, necessary paperwork, and curricular advice.</p>
<p>Current majors will also want to consult the link on this website detailing upcoming courses when planning their schedules. Students with credit from EAP courses should also consult with the Faculty Undergraduate Adviser for help in determining requirement equivalencies.<a name="minor"></a></p>
	</div><!-- .entry-content-wrapper -->
</article><!-- #post-589 -->

										</div>
			</div><!-- #content -->

<article id="post-1236" class="group post-container entry-content">
	
				
	<header class="entry-header">
		<h1 class="entry-title">Minor in Scandinavian</h1>
	</header><!-- .entry-header -->

	<div class="entry-content-wrapper">
		<p>A minor in Scandinavian adds depth to many other major courses of study, especially those with special stakes in Scandinavian material, such as Architecture, Environmental Design, Economics, History, Political Science, Comparative Literature, Film, and English. It is not necessary to study a Scandinavian language to minor in Scandinavian; all upper-division courses are taught in English with texts in translation and are easily accessible to students with general interests in Scandinavian culture.</p>
<p class="p2">The requirements include five upper-division electives of the student&#8217;s choosing.</p>
<p class="p2">Students with credit from EAP courses in Denmark and Sweden should consult with the Faculty Undergraduate Adviser for help in determining requirement equivalencies.</p>
	</div><!-- .entry-content-wrapper -->
</article><!-- #post-1236 -->

										</div>
			</div><!-- #content -->



<div class="image-key wideness"><img src="http://blogs.lscrtest.com/scandinavian/wp-content/themes/scandinavian/images/keys/programs.jpg" class="tooltip" title="The &ldquo;ant chair&rdquo; gets its name from the thorax shape of the back and seat, and was designed in 1952 by the influential Danish architect and designer Arne Jacobsen (1902-71) to be modular, light, and easily stackable. " alt=""></div>
	</div><!-- #main -->

<header id="site-header" class="home wideness" role="banner">
		<div class="upper-field">
		<a href="#">
			
			<div class="initial-quote">Det gjør ikke noget at være født i Andegaarden, naar man kun har ligget i et Svaneæg.</div>			
				<div class="mouse-over-quote">
					It does not matter if one is born in an duck yard, as long as one comes from a swan’s egg. (Danish) 				</div>
				
		
				<span class="quote-author"> - Hans Christian Andersen</span>

			<div class="site-header-content">
	 <h1><a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu">  Study Abroad</a></h1>
	 </div>

<article id="post-618" class="group post-container entry-content">
	
				
	<header class="entry-header">
		<h1 class="entry-title">Study Abroad</h1>
	</header><!-- .entry-header -->

	<div class="entry-content-wrapper">
		<p>The University of California Education Abroad Program (EAP) runs programs in Denmark, Norway, and Sweden in the summer and also during the academic year, tailored for a variety of needs, interests, and levels of linguistic competence. <em>Fall, Spring, academic-year, and summer programs for junior-semester-abroad opportunities offer continuing language study coupled with a variety of subjects, many applicable to fulfill major and minor requirements in Scandinavian with advance advising.</em></p>
<p>An academic-year program is available at three universities: the University of Copenhagen for Danish language and cultural studies, the University of Oslo for cultural studies and science courses in English, and the University of Lund for study in Swedish language and cultural studies.</p>
<p>For UC Berkeley study-abroad programs for Summer, Fall, Spring, and academic-year programs, see the links provided.</p>
<p><a href="http://eap.ucop.edu/OurPrograms/denmark/Pages/default.aspx"><em>Study Abroad in Denmark</em></a></p>
<p><a href="http://eap.ucop.edu/OurPrograms/Norway/Pages/default.aspx"><em>Study Abroad in Norway</em></a></p>
<p><a href="http://eap.ucop.edu/OurPrograms/sweden/Pages/default.aspx"><em>Study Abroad in Sweden</em></a><strong> </strong></p>
<p>To search for complete application, scholarship, and related information, <a href="//studyabroad.berkeley.edu/find-a-program"><em>view</em></a> the homepage for the Berkeley Program for Study Abroad. For questions, your UC Berkeley Program representative for Study Abroad in Scandinavia is Nadine Gerdes, <a href="mailto:nadine@berkeley.edu">nadine@berkeley.edu</a>; (510) 642-1356. Appointments are available by contacting Ms. Gerdes.</p>
<p>Students occasionally choose to go on a study-abroad program in Scandinavian countries that is not run by EAP. While this can be a productive option, the transfer of credits can be a significant issue, and students should become well informed both about the credentials of the program of interest and the procedures for counting work done toward one&#8217;s UCB degree. Details on EAP-sponsored programs, application requirements, and information on study abroad through other institutions can be found by starting with their <a href="//studyabroad.berkeley.edu/find-a-program"><em>home page</em></a>.</p>
<p><strong>Major and Minor Advising Before Applying to a Study-Abroad Program</strong></p>
<p>Declared or prospective majors for all concentrations in the Scandinavian major or those planning a minor should arrange an appointment with our Undergraduate Student Services Advisor well in advance of applying to any program for study abroad. Issues including language preparation prior to departure, the timely completion of major or minor requirements, preliminary review of potential courses to be taken abroad, time to degree, and others will be discussed and a workable study-list plan will be established. With careful planning, students can apply to their program of choice with confidence that requirements will be met while enjoying their experience abroad.</p>
<p>Upon approval, up to three courses (12 units) may be applied in fulfillment of major requirements; for minors, up to two courses (8 units) may be applied toward minor requirements.</p>
<p>For an appointment, contact <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/people/amanda-minafo/">Amanda Minafo</a>, Undergraduate Student Services Advisor.</p>
<p>For confirmation of transferable coursework credit for the major or minor upon your return, plan to make an appointment with the current Faculty Undergraduate Advisor in the Department of Scandinavian (information on the current faculty assignment is available <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/people-category/permanent-faculty/"><em>here</em></a>).</p>
<p><strong>Danish and Swedish Language Proficiency</strong></p>
<p>Programs emphasizing the study of Danish or Swedish language and culture require a pre-departure proficiency at a minimum of 1 year of elementary language study. Course lectures, reading, and written assignments are normally taught in the language of the country, with the exception of the summer program in Denmark. For questions regarding your proficiency level to ensure successful study abroad, please contact Karen Møller, Scandinavian Department Language Program Coordinator: <a href="mailto:kmoller@berkeley.edu">kmoller@berkeley.edu</a></p>
	</div><!-- .entry-content-wrapper -->
</article><!-- #post-618 -->

										</div>
			</div><!-- #content -->

" alt=""></div>

<div id="wrapper" class="hfeed">
	
<header id="site-header" class="home wideness" role="banner">
		<div class="upper-field">
		<a href="#">
			
			<div class="initial-quote">Valr lá þar á sandi<br />
vitinn inum eineygja<br />
Friggjar faðmbyggvi;<br />
fǫgnuðum dáð slíkri.</div>			
				<div class="mouse-over-quote">
					The slain lay there on the sand,<br />
dedicated to the one-eyed<br />
embrace-occupier of Frigg;<br />
we welcomed such doings. <br />
(Old Norse)				</div>
				
		
				<span class="quote-author"> - Hrafnsmál, Stanza 12</span>
				
			</a>
			
									 
	
	
	</div>
	
			<div class="site-header-content">
	 <h1><a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu">  Who to See for Advising</a></h1>
	 </div>
			<nav id="main-nav" role="navigation">
				<div class="menu-main-menu-container"><ul id="menu-main-menu" class="sf-menu"><li id="menu-item-1580" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-home menu-item-1580"><a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/">Home</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-1592" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-1592"><a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/news-and-events/">News &#038; Events</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-1627" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page current-page-ancestor menu-item-has-children menu-item-1627"><a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/programs/undergraduate/">Programs</a>

<article id="post-587" class="group post-container entry-content">
	
				
	<header class="entry-header">
		<h1 class="entry-title">Who to See for Advising</h1>
	</header><!-- .entry-header -->

	<div class="entry-content-wrapper">
		<p>The Department offers advising services for undergraduates that include referrals for language placement; study-list planning for majors, double majors, and minors; transfer-student requirements; summer course offerings; information about breadth requirements assigned to our courses; and preliminary approval of coursework pertaining to study abroad to fulfill requirements for the major, minor, or double major.</p>
<p>Students who would like to have an appointment to discuss declaring a major, double major, or minor in Scandinavian (or transfer students with questions about the program) should consult with Amanda Minafo, the Undergraduate Student Services Advisor for the Department of Scandinavian. For questions and appointments contact her via email: <a href="mailto:issaug@berkeley.edu">issaug@berkeley.edu</a>. Questions by phone: 510-642-4661.</p>
	</div><!-- .entry-content-wrapper -->
</article><!-- #post-587 -->

										</div>
			</div><!-- #content -->



<div class="image-key wideness"><img src="http://blogs.lscrtest.com/scandinavian/wp-content/themes/scandinavian/images/keys/programs.jpg" class="tooltip" title="The &ldquo;ant chair&rdquo; gets its name from the thorax shape of the back and seat, and was designed in 1952 by the influential Danish architect and designer Arne Jacobsen (1902-71) to be modular, light, and easily stackable. " alt=""></div>
	</div><!-- #main -->

	<footer id="footer" class="wideness" role="contentinfo">

			<div class="initial-quote">Jag föraktar människor som har hund, de är veklingar som inte törs bita själva.</div>

				<h1 class="event-home-title">
					<a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/more-job-market-successes/" title="More Job Market Successes!" rel="bookmark">	
						More Job Market Successes!					</a>
				</h1>
								
			<p>Scandinavian Department graduate successes on the job market continue&#8230; <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/more-job-market-successes/#more-2021" class="more-link"><span aria-label="Continue reading More Job Market Successes!">(more&hellip;)</span></a></p>
			
			</article><!-- news wrapper -->
					
<article class="home-news-wrapper">
		
				<h1 class="event-home-title">
					<a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/academic-job-market-successes/" title="Academic Job Market Successes!" rel="bookmark">	
						Academic Job Market Successes!					</a>
				</h1>
								
			<p>It has been a bumper year for graduates and associates of the Scandinavian Department on the job market. Starting new positions this summer are&#8230; <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/academic-job-market-successes/#more-1983" class="more-link"><span aria-label="Continue reading Academic Job Market Successes!">(more&hellip;)</span></a></p>
			
			</article><!-- news wrapper -->
					
<article class="home-news-wrapper">
		
				<h1 class="event-home-title">
					<a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/summer-awards-for-graduate-study-abroad/" title="Summer Awards for Graduate Study Abroad" rel="bookmark">	
						Summer Awards for Graduate Study Abroad					</a>
				</h1>
								
			<p>Two of our graduate students have won awards to study Scandinavian languages abroad this summer.</p>
<p> <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/summer-awards-for-graduate-study-abroad/#more-1988" class="more-link"><span aria-label="Continue reading Summer Awards for Graduate Study Abroad">(more&hellip;)</span></a></p>
			
			</article><!-- news wrapper -->
					
<article class="home-news-wrapper">
		
				<h1 class="event-home-title">
					<a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/congratulations-celine/" title="Congratulations, Celine!" rel="bookmark">	
						Congratulations, Celine!					</a>
				</h1>
								
			<p>Celine Vezina, double major in Scandinavian and English, has received a <a href="http://surf.berkeley.edu/">Summer Undergraduate Research Fellowship</a>  <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/congratulations-celine/#more-1980" class="more-link"><span aria-label="Continue reading Congratulations, Celine!">(more&hellip;)</span></a></p>
			
			</article><!-- news wrapper -->
					
<article class="home-news-wrapper">
		
				<h1 class="event-home-title">
					<a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/1975-2/" title="Mark Sandberg presents &#8220;Ibsen&#8217;s Houses&#8221; in New York" rel="bookmark">	
						Mark Sandberg presents &#8220;Ibsen&#8217;s Houses&#8221; in New York					</a>
				</h1>
								<figure class="news-home-thumb">
				<a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/1975-2/" title="Mark Sandberg presents &#8220;Ibsen&#8217;s Houses&#8221; in New York" rel="bookmark">
					<img width="100" height="151" src="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/978110703392401-100x151.jpg" class="attachment-news size-news wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/978110703392401-100x151.jpg 100w, http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/978110703392401-199x300.jpg 199w, http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/978110703392401.jpg 429w" sizes="(max-width: 100px) 100vw, 100px" />				</a>
			</figure>
						
			<p><a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/people/mark-sandberg/">Mark Sandberg</a>, Professor of Norwegian and Film and Media, recently gave a talk on his new book, <i>Ibsen&#8217;s Houses: Architectural Metaphor and the Modern Uncanny</i>, at <a href="http://www.tfana.org/">Theatre for a New Audience</a> in Brooklyn, New York.</p>
<p> <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/1975-2/#more-1975" class="more-link"><span aria-label="Continue reading Mark Sandberg presents &#8220;Ibsen&#8217;s Houses&#8221; in New York">(more&hellip;)</span></a></p>
			
			</article><!-- news wrapper -->
					
<article class="home-news-wrapper">

						Congratulations, Class of 2017!					</a>
				</h1>
								
			<p>On May 15, the Scandinavian Department celebrated Commencement for 2017. <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/congratulations-class-of-2017/#more-1971" class="more-link"><span aria-label="Continue reading Congratulations, Class of 2017!">(more&hellip;)</span></a></p>
			
			</article><!-- news wrapper -->
					
<article class="home-news-wrapper">
		
				<h1 class="event-home-title">

						2016-17 Outstanding GSI: Ida Johnson					</a>
				</h1>
								<figure class="news-home-thumb">
				<a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/2016-17-outstanding-gsi-ida-johnson/" title="2016-17 Outstanding GSI: Ida Johnson" rel="bookmark">
					<img width="100" height="144" src="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Ida-Johnson-100x144.jpg" class="attachment-news size-news wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Ida-Johnson-100x144.jpg 100w, http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Ida-Johnson.jpg 151w" sizes="(max-width: 100px) 100vw, 100px" />				</a>
			</figure>
						
			<p><a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/people/ida-moen-johnson/">Ida Moen Johnson</a> is the winner of the Outstanding GSI Award for 2016 for her work in teaching Norwegian.  <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/2016-17-outstanding-gsi-ida-johnson/#more-1969" class="more-link"><span aria-label="Continue reading 2016-17 Outstanding GSI: Ida Johnson">(more&hellip;)</span></a></p>

<article id="post-1988" class="group wide-side-post-container">
	<header class="entry-header">
		<h1 class="welcome-title">Summer Awards for Graduate Study Abroad</h1>
	</header><!-- .entry-header -->

	<div class="welcome-content">
	
	    
	
		<p>Two of our graduate students have won awards to study Scandinavian languages abroad this summer.</p>
<p><span id="more-1988"></span><a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/people/troy-smith/">Troy Wellington Smith</a> will study Danish at Studieskolen in Copenhagen, and <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/people/tiffany-white/">Tiffany White</a> will study Icelandic in Reykjavík and Ísafjörður.</p>
<p><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1269" src="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/Troy-Smith_profile2.jpg" alt="" width="151" height="218" srcset="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/Troy-Smith_profile2.jpg 151w, http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/Troy-Smith_profile2-100x144.jpg 100w" sizes="(max-width: 151px) 100vw, 151px" />     <img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1330" src="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/Tiffany-White3.jpg" alt="" width="151" height="218" srcset="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/Tiffany-White3.jpg 151w, http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/Tiffany-White3-100x144.jpg 100w" sizes="(max-width: 151px) 100vw, 151px" /></p>
<p>Congratulations, Troy and Tiffany!</p>
	</div><!-- .welcome-content -->

</article><!-- #post-1988 -->

			

			</div>
		</div><!-- #content-container -->

        });

				<article id="post-582" class="group post-container entry-content">

				<header class="index-header">
						<h1 class="index-title">Hm. Looks like something went wrong&hellip;</h1>
				</header>		

			

					<div class="index-content">
						<p>It seems we can’t find what you’re looking for. If you are looking for a specific post, try searching up in the right-hand corner. Otherwise take a look at our most recent posts below.</p>
					</div><!-- .entry-content -->
				</article><!-- #post-0 -->
				
			
			

</section><!-- #content-container -->
			</div><!-- #content -->

	<li id="menu-item-1624" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-1624"><a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/languages/swedish/">Swedish</a></li>
	<li id="menu-item-1620" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-1620"><a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/languages/distance-learning/">Distance Learning</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul></div>			</nav><!-- #access -->
			
	</header><!-- #site-header -->
	
	<div id="main" class="group">
			<div class="content wideness" role="main">
				<div class="page">
							<div id="sidebar-wide" class="widget-area sidebar-home" role="complementary">

				<h1 class="event-home-title">
					<a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/more-job-market-successes/" title="More Job Market Successes!" rel="bookmark">	
						More Job Market Successes!					</a>
				</h1>
								
			<p>Scandinavian Department graduate successes on the job market continue&#8230; <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/more-job-market-successes/#more-2021" class="more-link"><span aria-label="Continue reading More Job Market Successes!">(more&hellip;)</span></a></p>
			
			</article><!-- news wrapper -->
					
<article class="home-news-wrapper">
		
				<h1 class="event-home-title">
					<a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/academic-job-market-successes/" title="Academic Job Market Successes!" rel="bookmark">	
						Academic Job Market Successes!					</a>
				</h1>
								
			<p>It has been a bumper year for graduates and associates of the Scandinavian Department on the job market. Starting new positions this summer are&#8230; <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/academic-job-market-successes/#more-1983" class="more-link"><span aria-label="Continue reading Academic Job Market Successes!">(more&hellip;)</span></a></p>
			
			</article><!-- news wrapper -->
					
<article class="home-news-wrapper">
		
				<h1 class="event-home-title">
					<a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/summer-awards-for-graduate-study-abroad/" title="Summer Awards for Graduate Study Abroad" rel="bookmark">	
						Summer Awards for Graduate Study Abroad					</a>
				</h1>
								
			<p>Two of our graduate students have won awards to study Scandinavian languages abroad this summer.</p>
<p> <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/summer-awards-for-graduate-study-abroad/#more-1988" class="more-link"><span aria-label="Continue reading Summer Awards for Graduate Study Abroad">(more&hellip;)</span></a></p>
			
			</article><!-- news wrapper -->
					
<article class="home-news-wrapper">
		
				<h1 class="event-home-title">
					<a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/congratulations-celine/" title="Congratulations, Celine!" rel="bookmark">	
						Congratulations, Celine!					</a>
				</h1>
								
			<p>Celine Vezina, double major in Scandinavian and English, has received a <a href="http://surf.berkeley.edu/">Summer Undergraduate Research Fellowship</a>  <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/congratulations-celine/#more-1980" class="more-link"><span aria-label="Continue reading Congratulations, Celine!">(more&hellip;)</span></a></p>
			
			</article><!-- news wrapper -->
					
<article class="home-news-wrapper">
		
				<h1 class="event-home-title">
					<a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/1975-2/" title="Mark Sandberg presents &#8220;Ibsen&#8217;s Houses&#8221; in New York" rel="bookmark">	
						Mark Sandberg presents &#8220;Ibsen&#8217;s Houses&#8221; in New York					</a>
				</h1>
								<figure class="news-home-thumb">
				<a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/1975-2/" title="Mark Sandberg presents &#8220;Ibsen&#8217;s Houses&#8221; in New York" rel="bookmark">
					<img width="100" height="151" src="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/978110703392401-100x151.jpg" class="attachment-news size-news wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/978110703392401-100x151.jpg 100w, http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/978110703392401-199x300.jpg 199w, http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/978110703392401.jpg 429w" sizes="(max-width: 100px) 100vw, 100px" />				</a>
			</figure>
						
			<p><a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/people/mark-sandberg/">Mark Sandberg</a>, Professor of Norwegian and Film and Media, recently gave a talk on his new book, <i>Ibsen&#8217;s Houses: Architectural Metaphor and the Modern Uncanny</i>, at <a href="http://www.tfana.org/">Theatre for a New Audience</a> in Brooklyn, New York.</p>
<p> <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/1975-2/#more-1975" class="more-link"><span aria-label="Continue reading Mark Sandberg presents &#8220;Ibsen&#8217;s Houses&#8221; in New York">(more&hellip;)</span></a></p>
			
			</article><!-- news wrapper -->
					
<article class="home-news-wrapper">
		
				<h1 class="event-home-title">

						Congratulations, Class of 2017!					</a>
				</h1>
								
			<p>On May 15, the Scandinavian Department celebrated Commencement for 2017. <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/congratulations-class-of-2017/#more-1971" class="more-link"><span aria-label="Continue reading Congratulations, Class of 2017!">(more&hellip;)</span></a></p>
			
			</article><!-- news wrapper -->
					
<article class="home-news-wrapper">
		
				<h1 class="event-home-title">
					<a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/2016-17-outstanding-gsi-ida-johnson/" title="2016-17 Outstanding GSI: Ida Johnson" rel="bookmark">	
						2016-17 Outstanding GSI: Ida Johnson					</a>
				</h1>
								<figure class="news-home-thumb">
				<a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/2016-17-outstanding-gsi-ida-johnson/" title="2016-17 Outstanding GSI: Ida Johnson" rel="bookmark">
					<img width="100" height="144" src="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Ida-Johnson-100x144.jpg" class="attachment-news size-news wp-post-image" alt="" srcset="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Ida-Johnson-100x144.jpg 100w, http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Ida-Johnson.jpg 151w" sizes="(max-width: 100px) 100vw, 100px" />				</a>
			</figure>
						
			<p><a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/people/ida-moen-johnson/">Ida Moen Johnson</a> is the winner of the Outstanding GSI Award for 2016 for her work in teaching Norwegian.  <a href="http://scandinavian.berkeley.edu/2016-17-outstanding-gsi-ida-johnson/#more-1969" class="more-link"><span aria-label="Continue reading 2016-17 Outstanding GSI: Ida Johnson">(more&hellip;)</span></a></p>

<article id="post-1153" class="group wide-side-post-container">
	<header class="entry-header">
		<h1 class="welcome-title">The Department of Scandinavian is on Facebook</h1>
	</header><!-- .entry-header -->

	<div class="welcome-content">
	
	    
	
		<p>Follow our Facebook page (<a href="https://www.facebook.com/ucbscandinavian/">Department of Scandinavian UC Berkeley</a>) <span id="more-1153"></span>for more discussion of upcoming events, reports of faculty and student travel, linguistic puzzlers, and links to interesting current events in Scandinavia. If you have been one of the many visitors to the Department over the years, this is one way to keep connected to what is going on here in Berkeley!</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
	</div><!-- .welcome-content -->

</article><!-- #post-1153 -->

			

			</div>
		</div><!-- #content-container -->



	</div><!-- #main -->

		<div class="upper-field">
		<a href="#">
			
			<div class="initial-quote">Hvis jeg visste hva som var meningen med livet, trengte jeg ikke å skrive. Da kunne jeg bare sitte og vite.</div>			
				<div class="mouse-over-quote">
					If I knew the meaning of life, I wouldn’t need to write—I could just sit around knowing it. (Norwegian)				</div>
				
		
				<span class="quote-author"> - Erlend Loe</span>
				
			</a>

				<article id="post-581" class="group post-container entry-content">

				<header class="index-header">
						<h1 class="index-title">Hm. Looks like something went wrong&hellip;</h1>
				</header>		

			

					<div class="index-content">
						<p>It seems we can’t find what you’re looking for. If you are looking for a specific post, try searching up in the right-hand corner. Otherwise take a look at our most recent posts below.</p>

jQuery(document).ready(function($){
    $(".gallery img").each(function(){
        var alt = $(this).attr("alt");
        $(this).parent().attr("title",function(i,val){
            return val == alt ? "" : alt;
        });
    });
});
</script>
